name: Dozens
slogan: Dozens aims to make saving easier and more rewarding for all
description:
Dozens (www.dozens.com) is Project Imagine's first consumer brand - a spender-saver-investor proposition for retail customers in the UK.

Dozens will only make money when its customers make money, and will offer...

- Spending through a contactless Mastercard debit card and current account
- Best FX rates and seamless international remittances
- Saving through an intelligent budgeter and 5% fixed interest bonds
- Investing in risk-adjusted thematic portfolios reflecting one’s world views, and
- carefully thought-through sweepstakes incentives to reward good financial behaviour

...all in one easy-to-use, beautiful app!

jobs.title: Customer Service Associate
jobs.description:
Dozens has created a new home for your money. It brings together a current account,  smart budgeting tool, and a savings and investment manager – all in one app.

Bank’s dependence on their customer’s debt to drive their profit means consumers are rewarded more for spending than for saving. Dozens was created to make saving easier and more rewarding for all, and is founded on a fundamentally new business model: we only make money when our customers do. We’re putting the ‘fin’ back in ‘fintech’ by focusing on innovative financial products that are designed to help our customers better manage their money.

We’re looking for Customer Service Associates to be the first point of contact as we support our customers on their journey from spenders to savers to investors. You’ll be the human element at the heart of our customers Dozens experience, quickly solving any problems, answering questions and making sure their feedback (good or bad) is heard by the right teams.

What you’ll be doing

Responding sensitively and transparently to customer queries across platforms, including live chat, email, phone and social media.
Taking ownership of a customer problem, investigating and following it through to a solution where the customer is satisfied.
Keeping up to date with the latest app changes, and providing customer insight feedback to our product teams.
Developing an understanding of patterns in customer queries, prioritising and proactively suggesting areas where we can improve processes or product features to make our customers happier.
Working closely with our compliance and financial crime teams as our first line of defence against scammers and fraudsters.
You’ll enjoy this role if you are

Positive and enthusiastic
Empathetic
Detail oriented
A natural problem solver
Reliable and diligent
Excellent with both written and spoken English
Excited about building a better financial future for potentially millions of people
Complaints handling experience is desirable but not essential for this role. 

Both full time and part time positions are available (evenings and weekends). £24,000, adjusted for part timers. 

Please also note that our opening hours are 7am-10pm on business days and 10am-4pm  on weekends and holidays. Candidates must be available during some of the hours outside of the usual business day.

If offered a role, you will be on a 3 month contract with the possibility to extend or become permanent.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Payments Operations Analyst
jobs.description:
Dozens has created a new home for your money. It brings together a current account, a smart budgeting tool, and a savings and investment manager – all in one app.

Banks’ dependence on their customers’ debt to drive their profit means consumers are rewarded more for spending than for saving. Dozens was created to make saving easier and more rewarding for all, and is founded on a fundamentally new business model; we only make money when our customers do. We’re putting the ‘fin’ back in ‘fintech’ by focusing on innovative financial products.

We are not a bank. But we take our obligations to our regulators and our customers very seriously, so our payments team have an incredibly important role in making sure all payments have been processed correctly and without delays. 

We’re looking for Payments Operations Analyst to help us manage customer payments queries. We offer 6 months FTC with a possibility to become permanent. 

What you’ll be doing

Perform the day to day processing of all payments & refunds
Processing all missing payments queries and chargebacks
Perform daily reconciliation of client accounts
Partnering with our customer service team to make sure we manage expectations and keep customers in the loop 
Continuously looking for opportunities to improve the payments operations processes
You’ll enjoy this role if you are

A keen researcher with a sharp eye for detail
An excellent communicator with flawless written and spoken English, and the ability to simply and clearly explain complex rules to customers
A problem solver that enjoys figuring out how to continually improve processes and spot patterns
An organised and hard worker, who can keep on track of varying numbers of requests and doesn’t mind the occasional late evening or weekend if necessary (time will be repaid in lieu)
Someone with a genuine interest in payments and calculations 
A person that delights on getting stuck in and you’re keen to learn. 
Able to handle a large volume of information
Autonomous, proactive, self-dependent
Resourceful, creative and inquisitive approach to highly complex tasks
Fixed Term Contract for 6 months with a possibility to become permanent based on performance. 

Salary is at £24,000 p.a. calculated pro rata
